        Parameters:

        y - : y-coordinate of grid destination

      • navigateTunnel

        public static void navigateTunnel(double LL_X,
                                  double LL_Y,
                                  double UR_X,
                                  double UR_Y)
        navigates the robot across a tunnel and stops 1 tile after leaving tunnel end
        Parameters:
        LL_X - the x coordinate of the lower left point of the tunnel
        LL_Y - the y coordinate of the lower left point of the tunnel
        UR_X - the x coordinate of the upper right point of the tunnel
        UR_Y - the y coordinate of the upper right poitn of the tunnel

      • turnBy

        public static void turnBy(double angle)
        Turns the robot by a specified angle. Note that this method is different from Navigation.turnTo(). For example, if the robot is facing 90 degrees, calling turnBy(90) will make the robot turn to 180 degrees, but calling Navigation.turnTo(90) should do nothing (since the robot is already at 90 degrees).
        Parameters:
        angle - the angle by which to turn, in degrees

      • moveDistFwd

        public static void moveDistFwd(int distance,
                               int speed)
        Rotates forward in a straight line for specified distance.
        Parameters:
        distance - the distance
        speed - the speed in deg/s
